intro: Tithymalus attenuatus, commonly known as the slender tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Tithymalus attenuatus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along roadsides.
